data.question: What ligands were used to construct the Gd–Cu frameworks?
data.answer: Isophthalate (ip) as the oxygen-donor ligand and 2,2’-bipyridine (bpy) as the nitrogen-donor ligand.

data.question: Why are the magnetic properties of the first and second Gd–Cu frameworks different?
data.answer: Because of the different interactions between metal ions and the different structural arrangements.

data.answer: Different-sized complex cations result in frameworks containing different cavities.

data.question: What role do the copper ions and bpy ligands play in the formation of Gd–ip frameworks?
data.answer: They form complex cations first, which then serve as structure-directing templates.

data.question: What is unusual about the encapsulated mode of the guests in the first Gd–Cu framework?

data.question: What was the purpose of using mixed ligands with different donor atoms?
